Text: Replay of the ENW Employee MeetingFor those of you who missed the ENW allemployee meeting on October th a replay of the meeting is now available You can access the replay at The replay is a little more than an hour long and will restart after completion Please click on the applicable link based on your location Thank you Greg Piper Sally Beck and Mark Pickering

Replay of the ENW Employee MeetingFor those of you who missed the ENW allemployee meeting on October th a replay of the meeting is now available You can access the replay at The replay is a little more than an hour long and will restart after completion Please click on the applicable link based on your location Thank you Greg Piper Sally Beck and Mark Pickering

Organizational AnnouncementPST As we continue to mold Enron Net Works into the service organization model discussed at the ENW All Employee meeting on Oct we are pleased to announce the following changes to the organization Steve Hotte currently transitioning into the role of CIO for Enron Americas will take responsibility for the following areas Gas Trading Zhiyong Wei Power Trading Steve Nat Back Office Ramesh Rao Commercial Coordination Tommy Yanowski John Paskin currently transitioning into role of CIO for Corporate Systems will lead the following teams ISC Allan Sommer Enterprise Portal Tony Mends Treasury Tom Conley IntranetLivelinkGraphics Scott Cleverly JoAnne Knodel Vikki McCullough CRM Strategy Kevin Guion Matrix with HRIS Kathy Schultea Steve Stock will move into the new role of Enterprise Frameworks reporting to Mark Pickering and will lead the following teams Architecture John Simmons Development Support Richard Burchfield Global Data Joe Wong MKM Arlene Ogden Enterprise RAC RAC Analytics Winston Jia RAC Infrastructure Ramesh Ganapathy Global Valuation Dana Docherty Interviews for a CIO for EGS are currently in progress Please join us in congratulating all of these individuals on their new responsibilities A copy of the Organization structure is attached for your review Greg Sally and Mark
